intro: Zyrphelis ciliaris subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf zyrphelis, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often with hairy surfaces, and the plant is native to the southeastern United States. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to native plant gardens.
